data.title: Vicente Aleixandre (Premio Nobel 1977) Obras Completas Volumen I Poesia (1924-1967) by Aleixandre, Vicente - Bousoño, Carlos: Very Good Soft cover (1978) 2nd Edition
data.meta_description: 2nd Edition - Soft cover - Madrid: Aguilar S.A. de Ediciones, 1978 - 1978 - Condition: Very Good - Sm.8° - 1180pp - Complete Works Volume I Poesia (1924-1967)Vicente Aleixandre (1898-1984) was a Spanish poet who was born in Seville. Aleixandre received the Nobel Prize for Literature in 1977 "for a creative poetic writing which illuminates man's condition in the cosmos and in present-day society, at the same time representing the great renewal of the traditions of Spanish poetry between the wars". Second edition, text in Spanish- Original Binding. The front cover is a little damaged, if not in very good condition - Vicente Aleixandre (Premio Nobel 1977) Obras Completas Volumen I Poesia (1924-1967)
data.text:
About this Item

Sm.8° - 1180pp - Complete Works Volume I Poesia (1924-1967)Vicente Aleixandre (1898-1984) was a Spanish poet who was born in Seville. Aleixandre received the Nobel Prize for Literature in 1977 "for a creative poetic writing which illuminates man's condition in the cosmos and in present-day society, at the same time representing the great renewal of the traditions of Spanish poetry between the wars". Second edition, text in Spanish- Original Binding. The front cover is a little damaged, if not in very good condition. Seller Inventory # 10077

Contact seller
